page.title: 08GEOGRAPHY
page.content: The area is bounded by{Bodmin Moor}in the North and the deep valley of the {River Fowey}in the South. It drops from 65O ft. at Warleggan Church to below 2OOft. in the Glynn Valley. There are numerous small, fast flowing streams, the Warleggan River being the largestand longest to flow down through the area, to the main River Fowey. This helps to form one of the boundaries of Warleggsn parish, Cardinham being the large parish of the area. The area has{gently rolling {slopes,}dropping sharply into the valleys, where deciduous trees like, oak, beech, ash, alder and willow grow., Further south you find{pine {tree plantations.} The combination of trees gives a tremendous variety of colour. The higher land is{granite}and this gives way to{sand stone slate}on the low land.
